# userInterfaceLevel

**Instance Property**

The elevation level of the interface.

## Declaration

```swift
var userInterfaceLevel: UIUserInterfaceLevel { get set }
```

## Discussion

Levels create a visual separation between different parts of your UI. Window content typically appears at the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceLevel/base] level. When you want parts of your UI to stand out from the underlying background, assign the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceLevel/elevated] level to them. For example, the system assigns the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceLevel/elevated] level to alerts and popovers.

## Getting and setting trait values

- **accessibilityContrast**: The accessibility contrast associated with the current environment.
- **activeAppearance**: A property that indicates whether the user interface has an active appearance.
- **displayGamut**: The gamut of the current display.
- **displayScale**: The display scale of the trait collection.
- **forceTouchCapability**: The Force Touch capability value of the trait collection.
- **headroomUsageLimit**: The HDR headroom usage limit associated with the current environment.
- **horizontalSizeClass**: The horizontal size class of the trait collection.
- **imageDynamicRange**: The image dynamic range associated with the current environment.
- **layoutDirection**: The layout direction associated with the current environment.
- **legibilityWeight**: The font weight to apply to text.
- **listEnvironment**: The style of the containing list in a collection view or table view.
- **preferredContentSizeCategory**: The font sizing option preferred by the user.
- **resolvesNaturalAlignmentWithBaseWritingDirection**: The setting for whether the system resolves natural alignment with base writing direction for the current environment.
- **sceneCaptureState**: The scene capture state for the current environment.
- **splitViewControllerLayoutEnvironment**: The split view controller layout for the current environment.
